title: Augusta, Georgia 2010 Adopted Budget
subject: city planning

description: It converts the City’s long-range plans and policies into services and programs; serves as a vehicle to communicate these plans to the public; details the costs of City services and programs; and, outlines the revenues (taxes and fees) that support the City services, including the rate of taxation for the coming fiscal year. [...] The budget process begins in the spring of each year with the development of the Contributory Budget Manuals which embody the budget formulation guidelines. [...] 1) Departments and Agencies submit detailed budget requests to the Budget Office in the Finance Department, which reviews and compiles the requests and makes recommendations to the Administrator. [...] AUGUSTA, GEORGIA – 2010 BUDGET 11 AUGUSTA, GEORGIA THE REPORTING ENTITY OPERATING POLICIES/GUIDELINES AND LEGAL REQUIREMENTS FOR BUDGETING ACCOUNTING, FINANCIAL REPORTING AND ANNUAL AUDIT FY 2010 AUGUSTA, GEORGIA – 2010 BUDGET 12 AUGUSTA, GEORGIA FY 2010 BUDGET THE REPORTING ENTITY: Augusta is located in the east central section of the state on the south bank of the Savannah River, which serves as [...] Augusta is the head of the navigation on the Savannah River and is 135 miles east of Atlanta, 127 miles northwest of the port of Savannah, and 72 miles southwest of Columbia, South Carolina. [...] The Government was created by legislative act in the State of Georgia in 1995 from the unification of the two governments, the City of Augusta, Georgia and Richmond County, Georgia. [...] The following organizations were excluded from the reporting entity because the elected officials of Augusta are not financially accountable for the organization, and based on the nature and significance of their relationship, exclusion of the organizations would not result in the presentation of misleading or incomplete financial statements. [...] Adoption of budget ordinance or resolution; form of budget a) On a date after the conclusion of the hearing required in subsection (f) of Code Section 36-81-5, the governing authority shall adopt a budget ordinance or resolution making appropriations for the fiscal year in such sums as the governing authority may deem sufficient, whether greater or less than the sums presented in the proposed budg [...] The following are the Augusta-Richmond County’s Governmental Fund Types: General Fund - The General Fund is the general operating fund of the County. [...] The chart below shows the actual changes in the millage rates for the Urban Services District (old City) and for the County based on the 2009 Tax Digest.
